SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models

Class Recipe

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models.Recipe
public class Recipe extends Object
A class representing a recipe. A recipe consists of a name, description, instructions, ingredients and amount of servings.

Provides methods for getting the name, description, instructions, ingredients, and amount of servings of a recipe object. Also provides methods for adding and removing ingredients, and for setting the name, description, instructions, and amount of servings of a recipe.

Since:
0.2
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen

  • Constructor Details

    • Recipe

      public Recipe(String name, String description, String instructions, int servings) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs a new recipe with the provided name, description, instructions, and number of servings.

      The method validates the provided parameters and initializes the recipe with the provided values if they are all valid. If any of the provided parameters are null or an empty string, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      The method also initializes an empty map to store the ingredients of the recipe.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the recipe
      description - the description of the recipe
      instructions - the instructions for the recipe
      servings - the number of servings of the recipe
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the provided parameters are null or an empty string.

  • Method Details

      Returns the description of the recipe.

      public String getInstructions()

    • getIngredients

      public List<Ingredient> getIngredients()
      Returns a list of all ingredients in the recipe.
      Returns:
      a list of all ingredients in the recipe

    • getIngredient

      public Ingredient getIngredient(String name) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns an ingredient with the provided name.

      The method checks if the ingredient with the provided name exists in the recipe. If the ingredient does not exist, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException. It also checks if the name is null or an empty string, and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the ingredient to get
      Returns:
      the ingredient with the provided name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null or an empty string, or if the ingredient does not exist in the recipe.

    • getServings

      public int getServings()
      Returns the number of servings of the recipe.
      Returns:
      the number of servings of the recipe

    • setName

      public void setName(String name) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the name of the recipe.

      The method checks if the name is null or an empty string, and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is. Otherwise, it sets the name of the recipe to the provided value.

      Parameters:
      name - the new name of the recipe
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null or an empty string.

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(String description) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the description of the recipe.

      The method checks if the description is null or an empty string, and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is. Otherwise, it sets the description of the recipe to the provided value.

      Parameters:
      description - the new description of the recipe
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the description is null or an empty string.

    • setInstructions

      public void setInstructions(String instructions) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the instructions for the recipe.

      The method checks if the instructions are null or an empty string, and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is. Otherwise, it sets the instructions for the recipe to the provided value.

      Parameters:
      instructions - the new instructions for the recipe
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the instructions are null or an empty string.

    • setServings

      public void setServings(int servings) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the number of servings of the recipe.

      The method checks if the number of servings is less than or equal to zero, and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is. Otherwise, it sets the number of servings of the recipe to the provided value.

      Parameters:
      servings - the new number of servings of the recipe
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of servings is less than or equal to zero.

    • addIngredient

      public void addIngredient(Ingredient ingredient) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Adds an ingredient to the recipe, or updates the amount of an ingredient if it already exists. Also sorts the ingredients in the recipe by amount after adding a new ingredient.

      The method checks if the provided ingredient is null, and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is. If the ingredient already exists in the recipe, the method updates the amount of the ingredient by adding the new amount to the existing amount. If the ingredient does not exist in the recipe, the method adds the ingredient to the recipe.

      Parameters:
      ingredient - the ingredient to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided ingredient is null.

    • removeIngredient

      public void removeIngredient(Ingredient ingredient) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Removes an ingredient from the recipe.

      The method checks if the ingredient is null, and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is. If the ingredient does not exist in the recipe, the method also throws an IllegalArgumentException. Otherwise, the method removes the ingredient from the recipe.

      Parameters:
      ingredient - the ingredient to remove
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the ingredient is null, or if the ingredient does not exist in the recipe.

    • sortIngredients

      private void sortIngredients()
      Sorts the ingredients in the recipe by amount, in ascending order.

    • toReadableString

      public String toReadableString()
      Returns a user-friendly string representation of the recipe.
      Returns:
      a string representation of the recipe. Including name, description, instructions, and servings. Also includes a list of ingredients, with the details of each ingredient.
